actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to provide for the personal safety of those persons engaged in furthering the foreign intelligence operations of the United States.

summary.text: Establishes maximum criminal penalties of ten years imprisonment and/or a $10,000 fine for anyone who willfully discloses information identifying or tending to identify a person as a present or former participant in United States foreign intelligence operations if: (1) the information has been designated by statute or Executive Order as requiring a specific degree of protection; or (2) the person disclosing the information knows or has reason to believe that such disclosure may prejudice the safety or well-being of the person identified.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the personal safety of those persons engaged in furthering the foreign intelligence operations of the United States.
